revised_title: Effects of High Altitude on Human Physiology: Observations in the Peruvian Andes
tldr: This article reports on a study conducted in the Peruvian Andes to understand the effects of high altitude on human physiological processes. Researchers observed changes in the body, such as increased red blood corpuscles and hemoglobin levels, and the development of mountain sickness. They also studied the capacity for continuous and spasmodic exercise at high altitudes and the ability of the human body to adapt to these conditions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Physiology
